remarks:
Define the "decimal constructor", which is used to build up "decimal integers" or "numeric terms" in base 10.  For example, ` ( ; ; ; 1 0 0 0 + ; ; ; 2 0 0 0 ) = ; ; ; 3 0 0 0 ` ~ 1kp2ke3k . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Apr-2015.) 

---

 Define the "decimal constructor", which is used to build up "decimal integers" or "numeric terms" in base 10.  For example, ` ( ; ; ; 1 0 0 0 + ; ; ; 2 0 0 0 ) = ; ; ; 3 0 0 0 ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Apr-2015.)
statement: df-dec $p |- ; A B = ( ( 10 x. A ) + B ) $.
